definitions.definition: subject to sin or depravity.
examples: fallen human nature

definitions.definition: (of a woman) regarded as having lost her honor through engaging in a sexual relationship outside marriage.
examples: a fallen woman with a checkered past

definitions.definition: (of a soldier) killed in battle.
examples: fallen heroes

definitions.definition: move downward, typically rapidly and freely without control, from a higher to a lower level.
examples: bombs could be seen falling from the planes

definitions.definition: become detached accidentally and drop to the ground.
examples: my sunglasses fell off and broke on the pavement

definitions.definition: hang down.
examples: hair that was allowed to fall to the shoulders

definitions.definition: (of land) slope downward; drop away.
examples: the land fell away in a steep bank
synonyms: plunge "the ground here falls away abruptly"

definitions.definition: (of a river) flow or discharge itself into.
(of someone's eyes or glance) be directed downward.
(of someone's face) show dismay or disappointment by appearing to sag or droop.
examples: her face fell as she thought about her life with George

definitions.definition: occur, arrive, or become apparent as if by dropping suddenly.
examples: when night fell we managed to crawl back to our lines
synonyms: come about; Morearise; literarycome to pass "Easter fell on April 11th"come

definitions.definition: (of a person) lose one's balance and collapse.
examples: she fell down at school today
synonyms: slip; informalcome a cropper "he tripped and fell"

definitions.definition: throw oneself down, typically in order to worship or implore someone.
examples: they fell on their knees, rendering thanks to God

definitions.definition: (of a tree, building, or other structure) collapse to the ground.
examples: the house looked as if it were going to fall down at any moment

definitions.definition: (of a building or place) be captured or defeated.
examples: their mountain strongholds fell to enemy attack
synonyms: be overwhelmed by "the town fell to the barbarians"

definitions.definition: die in battle.
examples: an English leader who had fallen at the hands of the Danes
synonyms: meet one's death; Moreinformalbite the dust
buy the farm "those who fell in the war"

definitions.definition: commit sin; yield to temptation.
examples: it is their husband's fault if wives do fall

definitions.definition: (of a government or leader) lose office.
(in sports) lose or be eliminated from play.
decrease in number, amount, intensity, or quality.
examples: in 1987 imports into Britain fell by 12 percent

definitions.definition: find a lower level; subside or abate.
examples: the water table in the Rift Valley fell

definitions.definition: (of a measuring instrument) show a lower reading.
examples: the barometer had fallen a further ten points

definitions.definition: pass into a specified state.
examples: many of the buildings fell into disrepair
synonyms: sack out "I almost fell asleep at work"

definitions.definition: begin to do something.
examples: he fell to musing about how it had happened

definitions.definition: be drawn accidentally into.
examples: you must not fall into this common error

definitions.definition: occur at a specified time.
examples: Mother's birthday fell on Flag Day

definitions.definition: be classified or ordered in the way specified.
examples: canals fall within the Minister's brief
